required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Strawberries on Cognition, and Vascular and Cardiometabolic Markers in Older Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to investigate the effects of strawberries on cognitive responses, motor control function, and vascular and cardiometabolic risk markers in healthy older adults.

detailed_description.textblock: To achieve the objectives, 40 healthy men and women â‰¥65 years of age will consume 26 g of freeze-dried strawberries in the form of a drink-mix daily for 8 wk. Using a randomized crossover study design, the effects will be compared to the effects of 8 wk intake of a placebo drink-mix (with a 4 wk wash-out period between trials). Cognitive function measurements will be performed at baseline and 8 wk. Additionally, at each timepoint, flow-mediated vasodilation and blood pressure will be measured followed by collection of fasting blood samples to assess glucose, insulin, blood lipids (free fatty acids, triacylglycerol, total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, and HDL cholesterol), inflammatory markers (interleukins 6 and 18), and markers of oxidative stress (oxidized LDL-C and malondialdehyde).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Using a randomized crossover study design, the effects will be compared to the effects of 8 wk intake of a placebo drink-mix (with a 4 wk wash-out period between trials).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in processing speed (cognition) at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: using Pattern Comparison Processing Speed Test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in executive function (cognition) at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: using Dimensional Change Card Sort Test; Flanker Inhibitory Control and Attention Test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in working memory (cognition) at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: using List Sorting Working Memory Test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in episodic memory (cognition) at 8 weeks
Change from baseline in working memory (cognition) at 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: using Picture Vocabulary Test; Oral Reading Recognition Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Vascular health at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: to better understand how changes in the gut microbiota through fruit consumption are linked to changes in health outcomes, we will assess endothelial function via flow-mediated vasodilation and risk factors for cardiometabolic dysfunction in fasting blood samples collected at baseline and after 8 weeks.

arm_group.description: Participants consume 1 package of standard strawberry powder (26 g) daily for 8 weeks
Participants consume 1 package of placebo powder (26 g) daily for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men and women 65 years and older
Exclusion Criteria:
- stroke or myocardial infarction
- neurological disorders:
- epilepsy,
- multiple sclerosis,
- Parkinson's disease,
- stroke
- known metabolic disorders:
- liver,
- renal
- clinically diagnosed diabetes
- drug treatment for lipid reduction or hypertension,
- psychiatric medication use
